alert.note: Alert for Avery; Buncombe; Madison; McDowell Mountains; Mitchell; Yancey (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 09 at 6:28AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern McDowell, east central Madison, Mitchell, southwestern Avery, northeastern Buncombe and Yancey Counties through 700 AM EDT... At 627 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles north of Spruce Pine to 6 miles northeast of Marshall. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Spruce Pine, Burnsville, Mars Hill, Bakersville, Mount Mitchell State Park, B.R. Parkway-East Asheville To Craggy Gardens, B.R. Parkway-Little Switzerland To Linville, B.R. Parkway-Craggy To Little Switzerland, Bandana and Ingalls. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Avery; Buncombe; Madison; McDowell Mountains; Mitchell; Yancey
